docs.text: OUXT Polaris Environment Setup Tool # What is it # This tool supports to build our software and deploy them into local_machine and real robot. This tool works on ansible .
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Build Instractions # If you want to know about supported platfroms, please see also this page . build this documentation locally # ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/localhost.ini ansible/build_document.yml --connection local --ask-become-pass install in local host (full package) # first time sudo apt install ansible ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/localhost.ini ansible/setup_full.yml --connection local --ask-become-pass not first time ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/localhost.ini ansible/update_full.yml --connection local --ask-become-pass install to test docker image # cd docker sh run.sh ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/docker.ini ansible/setup_docker.yml
docs.title: Build Instractions

docs.text: If you want to know about supported platfroms, please see also this page .
docs.title: Build Instractions

docs.text: ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/localhost.ini ansible/build_document.yml --connection local --ask-become-pass
docs.title: build this documentation locally

docs.text: first time sudo apt install ansible ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/localhost.ini ansible/setup_full.yml --connection local --ask-become-pass not first time ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/localhost.ini ansible/update_full.yml --connection local --ask-become-pass
docs.title: install in local host (full package)

docs.text: cd docker sh run.sh ansible-playbook -i ansible/hosts/docker.ini ansible/setup_docker.yml
docs.title: install to test docker image

docs.text: Navigation Demo # How to run demo # build packages # Please see also, this page . run simulator and planner # ros2 launch navi_sim with_planner.launch.py set goal # use 2d goal pose tool in rviz. then, the navigation starts. spawn obstacle # use clicked point tool in rviz then, replan waypoints.
docs.title: Navigation Demo

docs.text: Please see also, this page .
docs.title: build packages

docs.text: ros2 launch navi_sim with_planner.launch.py
docs.title: run simulator and planner

docs.text: use 2d goal pose tool in rviz. then, the navigation starts.
docs.title: set goal

docs.text: use clicked point tool in rviz then, replan waypoints.
docs.title: spawn obstacle

docs.text: Supported Platform # ubuntu 20.04 # If your ubuntu version is older than 20.04, you can use docker environment. ansible task install ROS2 foxy, so you do not necessary to setup ROS2 before you run ansible-script, you have to install ansible via apt sudo apt install ansible
docs.title: Supported Platform

docs.text: If your ubuntu version is older than 20.04, you can use docker environment. ansible task install ROS2 foxy, so you do not necessary to setup ROS2 before you run ansible-script, you have to install ansible via apt sudo apt install ansible
docs.title: ubuntu 20.04
